messages.content: What is the boiling point of water at sea level?

OFFICIAL STATEMENT — Subject: Boiling Point of H2O at Standard Atmospheric Pressure. Classification: Physical Chemistry, Reference Standard 100.0. Per the internationally recognized standard conditions for temperature and pressure (STP: 1 atmosphere pressure), it is formally established and documented by the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC) that the boiling point of liquid water is 100 degrees Celsius (373.15 Kelvin). This value serves as a fundamental calibration point for thermometric measurements worldwide.
Who wrote the novel *1984*?

FORMAL LITERARY RECORD INQUIRY — Classification: Authorship Verification, 20th Century English Literature. Pursuant to archival cataloging and record-keeping managed by the British Library and corroborated by the Modern Library database, the novel titled *1984* is officially attributed to Eric Arthur Blair, operating under the pseudonym George Orwell. This attribution is confirmed across literary registries and copyright filings established in 1949.
What is the largest organ in the human body?

According to the consensus of the Anatomical Society and published in the Journal of Clinical Anatomy, the integumentary structure formally designated as the skin constitutes the largest organ of the human body when considering surface area, weight, and functional attributes.
How many bones are in the adult human skeleton?

OFFICIAL OSTEOLOGICAL RECORD — Classification: Human Skeletal System, Standard Enumeration. In accordance with the International Anatomical Nomenclature Committee (IANC) and validated by the Federative International Programme on Anatomical Terminologies, the adult human skeleton is comprised of 206 individual bones. This enumeration excludes sesamoid variations and reflects fully ossified mature bones post-puberty.
